subject: Deletion of Tack Coat on Primed Granular Surface - reg.
text: M <e1q TANT Mearut 744 Phcna 91-11-25074100/25070200 ( Wae4 & <enf 4aq) Fax 91-11-25033507 25033614 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Tranaport and Highways) 3-5 W 6, #aet-10, aaT , #Rari-110075 G-5 & 6,Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Tack Coat/2o17 No.13.22/2017, Dated the 13th July, 2017 (Decision taken on File no.NHAI/11013/SRDGQIRC: 37-2012/Tack Coat/2016) Sub: Deletion of Tack Coat on Primed Granular Surface Though the utility of applying Tack Coat o bituminous surfaces is well known and its technical necessity is unquestionable, the application of tack coat on primed granular  surface such as Wet Mix Macadam (WMM) has been under debate for some time: developed countries also do not specify tack coat on primed granular surface_ 2 The issue was discussed in the meeting with professionals from the industry and academicians from IIT on 21st February, 2017 at NHAI HQ and it erierged that tack coat is not   required on primed granular surface such as WMM except where the bituminous surfacing required to be laid on it is less than 4Omm: The proposal to dispense with the tack coat on primed granular surface was re- affirmed by Executive Committee (EC) in its 309th Meeting on 14.06.2017. 3_ It therefore, been decided that the provision of tack coat on already primed granular surface be dispensed with except where the thickness of bituminous layer required to be laid on it is less than 4Omm. However, the prime coat shall be applied on all granular surfaces such as Wet Mix Macadam (WMM) as specified. 4 It is further clarified that the tack coat will be provided on a bituminous surface viz. Dense Bituminous Macadam (DBM) before   laying the next bituminous layer such as BC on it: contd_ Many has,
